Definition.WordDefinition: Confrontation \Con`fron*ta"tion\, n. [LL. confrontatio.] Act of confronting. --H. Swinburne. [1913 Webster] ||

confrontation n 1: a bold challenge 2: discord resulting from a clash of ideas or opinions 3: a hostile disagreement face-to-face [syn: {encounter}, {showdown}, {face-off}] 4: the act of opposing groups confronting each other; "the government was not ready for a confrontation with the unions"; "the invaders encountered stiff opposition" [syn: {opposition}] 5: a focussed comparison; bringing together for a careful comparison
